gnome.error: Could not connect to Kando Integration GNOME Shell extension. You can get it from here: {{- link}}

hyprland.shortcut-hint: Use your hyprland.conf to bind this.

kde-wayland.shortcut-hint: Use KDE's system settings to bind this.

main.invalid-link-message: The deep link could not be parsed.

command.name: Run Command
command.tip-1: You can use the Command item type to launch applications or scripts.
command.tip-2: If the path to an executable contains spaces, you should "wrap it in quotes".
command.tip-3: Use {{app_name}} to insert the name of the application which was focused when you opened the menu.
command.tip-4: Use {{window_name}} to insert the name of the window which was focused when you opened the menu.
command.tip-5: Use {{pointer_x}} and {{pointer_y}} to insert the pointer position where the menu was opened.

common.delayed-option-hint: This will execute the action after the menu has been closed. This is useful if the action targets a window that needs to be focused.

file.file-hint: A directory will be opened with your file browser. Other files will be opened with the default application.
file.name: Open File
file.tip-1: You can use this item type to open files or folders.

hotkey.hotkey-hint: This hotkey will be triggered when the item is selected. When recording, you do not have to press all keys at once, you can also press them one after another. This is useful if a hotkey is already bound to some global action!
hotkey.name: Simulate Hotkey
hotkey.tip-1: When recording a hotkey, you do not have to press all keys at once. You can press them one after another.
hotkey.tip-2: If you cannot record a key because it is used by the system, try typing its name directly.
hotkey.tip-3: Click [this link](%s) to see all valid key names.

macro.name: Simulate Macro
macro.tip-1: Per default, Kando adds a 10ms delay before each key event. You can change this with the "delay" property.
macro.tip-2: You can edit the macro also by hand. This is useful if you want to adjust the timing of the keys.

redirect.name: Redirect
redirect.redirect-hint: This menu will be opened when you activate this item.

settings.name: Open Settings
settings.tip-1: This action opens the Kando settings window.

submenu.name: Submenu
submenu.tip-1: Submenus can be used to group items.
submenu.tip-2: You can also nest submenus inside of submenus.
submenu.tip-3: Submenus can be used to create complex menu structures.
submenu.tip-4: You should avoid adding more than twelve items to a submenu. Eight is a good number.
submenu.tip-5: You can use the tiny lock icons in the preview to fix an item's position in the menu.
submenu.tip-6: You can reorder items by dragging them in the preview.
submenu.tip-7: You can delete a menu or a menu item with the trash icon below.

text.name: Paste Text
text.tip-1: This action uses your clipboard to paste the text. After using the action, the clipboard will contain the text.

uri.name: Open URI
uri.tip-1: You can use the URI item type to open a website using the http:// protocol.
uri.tip-2: You can use this to call custom URI schemes like slack:// or zoommtg://.
uri.tip-3: You can use the URI item type to open a mailto: link.
uri.tip-4: Use {{app_name}} to insert the name of the application which was focused when you opened the menu.
uri.tip-5: Use {{window_name}} to insert the name of the window which was focused when you opened the menu.
uri.tip-6: Use {{pointer_x}} and {{pointer_y}} to insert the pointer position where the menu was opened.
uri.uri-hint: This will be opened with your default application for this URI type.

settings.anchored-mode-hint: Open submenus at the same position as the parent menu. Checking this, will disable Marking Mode.
settings.app-condition-hint: Show the menu only if a specific application is focused. This supports regular expressions like /firefox|chrome/i.
settings.area-condition-hint: Show the menu only if the pointer is in a given area on the screen.
settings.centered-mode-hint: Open the menu in the screen's center instead of at the cursor.

general-settings-dialog.title: General Settings
general-settings-dialog.reload-menu-theme-tooltip: CSS changes will be applied immediately, for changes made to the theme.json file, you need to re-open the menu.

settings.hover-mode-hint: For power users only! Select items by hovering over them.

introduction-dialog.title: Welcome to Kando!
introduction-dialog.slide-1-caption: Click Anywhere: You do not have to exactly click on an item, you just have to click somewhere into its wedge!
introduction-dialog.slide-2-caption: Go Back: Quickly navigate one level up by clicking the center item.
introduction-dialog.slide-3-caption: Marking Mode: Drag over an item to enter marking mode. If you pause the pointer movement or make a turn, the currently dragged submenu will be opened.
introduction-dialog.slide-4-caption: Turbo Mode: If you keep a key pressed after opening the menu, you can perform selections by just moving the pointer. This is the fastest way to select items!
introduction-dialog.slide-5-caption: No accidental selections: Actions are only executed as soon as you release your mouse button in "Marking Mode" or a keyboard key in "Turbo Mode". Use this to explore the menu!

settings.menu-behavior-hint: Tweak advanced options for the menu.
settings.menu-behavior-subheading: Before you enable these options, we recommend learning Kando's default behavior. Read about why we like it here.
settings.menu-conditions-hint: Choose when the menu should be shown.
settings.menu-conditions-subheading: You can bind multiple menus to the same shortcut and then choose under which conditions each menu should be shown.

menu-themes-dialog.title: Menu Themes
menu-themes-dialog.author: by {{author}}
menu-themes-dialog.dark-mode: Use Separate Themes and Colors for Light and Dark Mode
menu-themes-dialog.hint: You can download themes from the theme repository. You can also learn how to create your own themes and share them in Kando's Discord Server!
menu-themes-dialog.label: Menu Themes
menu-themes-dialog.reset-color-picker: Reset all colors to their defaults
menu-themes-dialog.system-mode-subheading-dark: Your system is currently in dark mode. The settings above will only be used in dark mode.
menu-themes-dialog.system-mode-subheading-light: Your system is currently in light mode. The settings above will only be used in light mode.
menu-themes-dialog.system-mode-subheading: If enabled, you can choose a different theme and color set if your system is in light or dark color mode.

settings.warp-mouse-hint: Move the pointer to the center of the menu when it opens.
settings.window-condition-hint: Show the menu only if the focused window's title contains a given text. This supports regular expressions like /youtube|vimeo/i.
